extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes

title: Hot Pepper and Garlic Shrimp
summary: Hot Pepper and Garlic Shrimp might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains about 16g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 135 calories. For $1.68 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 12. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, shrimp in shell, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. With a spoonacular score of 37%, this dish is rather bad. Try Garlic Pepper Shrimp, Garlic Knot Hot Dogs, and Shrimp with Garlic and Chili Pepper for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Pat shrimp dry. Cook garlic, red pepper flakes, and sea salt in oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until garlic is pale golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Increase heat to moderately high, then add shrimp and sauté, turning occasionally, until shrimp are just cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, then transfer to a serving bowl. Serve warm or at room temperature.

steps.step: Pat shrimp dry. Cook garlic, red pepper flakes, and sea salt in oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until garlic is pale golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Increase heat to moderately high, then add shrimp and sauté, turning occasionally, until shrimp are just cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, then transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
